Frequentists assign probabilities to random events according to their frequencies of occurrence or to subsets of populations as proportions of the whole,
while describe probabilities in terms of beliefs and degrees of uncertainty.

can be found by calculating
by collecting the preference data of top-N nearest neighbors of the particular user

combined with an estimate from a unigram count, are re-normalized to get a probability distribution.

and implement descent,

For a given source vertex in the graph,
algorithm finds the path with lowest cost
(i.e. the shortest path) between that vertex and every other vertex.

Graphs can be classified according to two independent structural features:
the coefficient
and average node-to-node distance.

Brazil has one of the largest renewable energy programs in the world,
involving production of
from sugar cane.

helps public and private sector purchasers
evaluate, compare, and choose computers, notebooks, and monitors based on environmental attributes.
systems are based on solar electric cells, which convert solar radiation directly into electricity.

Traditionally electrical power
has been generated from
in large, centralized plants. Large-scale ambient energy, such as sun, wind and tides, is widely available but trickier to harvest.

What two things are required by every organism for growth? A source of organic carbon and a source of electrons. Energy is also required. Synthesizers get their energy input from the sun or thermal energy.
get energy from organic carbon.

I am not against global climate treaties,

but I think their chances of having the impact that their advocates predict are slim.

Probably the most oft-cited theory about the relationship between enviromental regulation and innovation
is the ' hypothesis', first expounded
by the Harvard Business School professor Michael Porter in 1991.

to reinstate the standard
for central air conditioners.

A September 14, 2007 study conducted by the National Science Foundation found that
biodiversity and diversity
are dependent upon each other.

The
hypothesis proposes that
the biosphere and the physical components of the Earth are coupled to form a complex interacting system.

call, or to request a call from the advertiser.

for example, is not that it's a software patent, but that it's obvious.

(including use of dividends to offset wage income to shareholders) and operates with much more settled law.

shares in the U.S. normally carry a call provision,
enabling the issuing corporation to repurchase the share at its (usually limited) discretion.

to describe other types of defenses that involve
the target taking some action that harms both target and bidder.

Very often, property names only make sense
when the is known.
For instance, in the Film type, it is enough to for a property to say "Budget" since it is understood it is the budget of a Film.

Cross-typing also provides similar capability to object inheritance. Although Metaweb does not support inheritance directly, types can declare other types they depend on
that include
that normally would be expected.

In a relational system, it might be more convenient to assign string literals as property values. In Metaweb however, it's just as easy to make them
with significant benefits.

The most interesting aspect of Arnold's topic is that it includes a user-created type, Impersonated Celebrity, from
the user-created of American Comedy.

The most important concept behind types is that new or existing types can be
added to a
in order to provide additional information about it and to add it to another domain.

The Editor provides an easy way
to go through the process of creating the set of properties, also known as the schema, that constitute the essential information about a type.

You can use the Query Editor to
perform operations
that insert new information into the Freebase database.

The value property of a key must be
a string of characters,
and may include letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens and dollar signs.

The /type/object type exists simply as a convenient placeholder. It serves to
the /type/ property objects
that represent the common object properties.

In order to make the data structure
more understandable to
, Metaweb allows us to view the graph through an object-oriented lens.

Every object has a permission property that refers to a /type/permission object. The permission object
specifies a set of
whose members have permission to modify the object.

A number of
important are populated
with pre-defined objects using names defined by international standards. The languages in /lang use language codes defined by ISO 639. The media types in /media_type are defined by IANA.

When creating /location/ location topics the idea is to provide (at least) two levels of hierarchical
containment in the property
. For example, in the US, cities should specify what county they are in as well as what state they are contained in.

If you have a large amount of data that you want to load into Freebase you should
first have a designed
for it. You should also take a look at the topics listed under Content Guidelines and Policies to make sure your data is appropriate for Freebase.

Mjt is a application framework
that runs entirely in a web browser, based on a templating engine.

Mjt is particularly useful with
services that return JSON values
and accept a callback= parameter, such as the Freebase service and the Yahoo JSON API . With these services you can use mjt to build "mash-ups" that incorporate data from services on multiple hosts.

The primary mechanism for fetching data is the dynamic <script src=""> tag. This has the advantage that it can be used to fetch data from
services on other .

A major feature of the application editor is
the ability to or import files
from applications created by you or other users. If you're a novice developer this is an easy way to bring working code into your own applications.

If an Acre script exits before calling acre.start_response(), a
response is generated.

Rails provides
which can automatically construct some of the models and views needed for a basic website.

"Convention over "
means a developer only needs to specify unconventional aspects of the application.

After version 2.0,on Rails by default
offers both HTML and as output format.
The latter is the facility for RESTful web services.

Rails views are where we leave Ruby code. Rails contains a very nice template language for .rhtml files that
combines purewith embedded Ruby code.

RHTML is a true template format --
not simply a way of embedding code in--
and this is a much more powerful approach.

A template engine
adds a custom set of tags toHTML
that allows you to express conditions, loops, and other logic as part of the enhanced markup.

carry out your application logic in its abstract form.
That is, the Ruby scripts in an application's app/controllers/ directory will load model data into variables, save it back, and massage and manipulate it.

The part of a Rails application
is primarily the underlying database it uses. In fact, in many ways a Rails application is just a way to perform manipulations on the data in a relational database management system.

A central component of Rails is the class ,
which maps relational tables to Ruby objects and thereby to the data manipulated by controllers and shown in views.

When you create a table, Rails wants it to be plural. Not story , but stories .
And it wants the primary key column
to always be called id, case sensitive.

All the programmer needs to do is to
subclass the ActiveRecord::Base ,
and the program will automatically figure out which RDBMS table to use and what columns the table has.

The underlying view code is
part of the Action Pack
.

The data validation handlers and any update-related handlers
(e.g. after_destroy :remove_file, before_update :update_related_details) are also specified and implemented in the model class.

The database access is entirely abstracted from the programmer's point of view, and Rails handles access to all databases automatically; though
the use of direct queries is possible, if necessary.

The character set used in the Ruby source files for the current implementation
is based on
.

Ruby comments start with " # "
outside of a string or character literal and all following text until the end of the line.

If the Ruby interpreter encounters a line beginning with =begin , it skips that line and all remaining lines through and including a line
that begins with =end.

Ruby programs are sequence of expressions.
Backslashes at the end of line
does not terminate expression.

As there is currently no specification of the Ruby language,
the implementation
is considered the de facto reference.

The main developers have thrown their weight behind the virtual machine
provided by the project,
which was merged into the Ruby source tree on 31 December 2006 , and released as part of Ruby 1.9.

It's possible to run Rails on
any platform that supports
. Apache, LiteSpeed, IIS are just a few.

is a Ruby based webserver
with a C component (which requires compilation) that is suitable for development and deployment of Rails applications.
